programmes.show_description: Connor Phillips is live through the night live from the Salford Riviera with Midnight Mastermind, Wish You Were There, Midnight Caller and a huge Ravio 2 to end the week.

programmes.show_name: Alternative Sounds of the 90s with Dermot O'Leary
programmes.show_description: Jude Law picks his favourite 90s band. Plus a mix of known and unknown tunes from JJ72, Asian Dub Foundation, Milltown Brothers and Death In Vegas.
Welcome! It's Early Breakfast with Owain Wyn Evans, featuring Airdrum Anthems and Step Back in Time. The 3 Ws today. Who are you, Where are you, What are you looking forward to?
Scott's got an iconic trio of guests with him in the studio for Big Guest Friday. It's comedian Jack Whitehall, Bake Off legend Prue Leith and singing sensation Beverley Knight!
Vernon is here to warm you up for the weekend ahead, with the final edition of Ten To The Top of the week.
Vernon has highlights from Week 3 of Radio 2's Piano Room Month 2026 - featuring Labi Siffre, Ella Eyre, Squeeze and Appleton accompanied by the BBC Concert Orchestra.
Jeremy and guests discuss the news headlines and talk to the people making them.
Trevor is bringing you some of the best music from across the decades to get you through the afternoon.
It's All Request Friday, and OJ Borg wants to hear from you on 88291 or sara.cox@bbc.co.uk.
A handpicked playlist of her favourite disco, dance, pop and R'n'B bangers.
Michelle's Mood is...ANIMATE ME! Your weekly 30 minutes of non-stop bops right here.
The Disco Zone is GO! Here comes two hours of tunes to move to. Sophie plays music from Spice Girls, Rudimental, One Direction, Beyonce and Vanilla Ice!

programmes.show_name: The Rock Show with Shaun Keaveny
programmes.show_description: Shaun curates an hour of the best rock ever heard on Radio 2.

programmes.show_name: Romesh Ranganathan: For the Love of Hip Hop
programmes.show_description: Rom catches up with West Coast legend Chali 2na, about his extensive solo career, Jurassic 5 classics and touring. Plus, music from Otis Mensah, Eve and Main Source.

Mark Goodier counts down the chart from this day in 1984.
The Verve's triumphant homecoming concert at Wigan's Haigh Hall in 1998. Featuring Space and Time, Sonnet, The Drugs Don't Work, Lucky Man and Bitter Sweet Symphony.

programmes.show_name: The Unwinds Mix with Angela Griffin
programmes.show_description: Angela Griffin wants you to unplug from the digital world, with an Unwinds Mix featuring Stevie Wonder, Basement Jaxx, Joni Mitchell and more.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 60s with Tony Blackburn
programmes.show_description: Tony brings you two hours of music from the best decade ever, with hits from Harpers Bizarre, The Bachelors and Edwin Starr. This week, the top three comes from 1964.
Oscar and BAFTA nominee Rose Byrne chats about her movie If I Had Legs I'd Kick You. Plus some classic vinyl, a wedding call and The Mystery Voice.
Actor Rosamund Pike (Saltburn, Gone Girl) joins Romesh live in the studio, ahead of the West End transfer of her play 'Inter Alia'.
Spend Saturday lunchtime with Emma and enjoy a menu full of your favourite music, great conversation and a delicious dive into the BBC archives for dessert.
Rylan is joined by the opera and classical vocal powerhouse Katherine Jenkins for a memorable KaRYoke. Also, Mummy Linda and Rob Rinder will be going head to head in a new feature.
Shaun Keaveny sits in with fabulous teatime tunes and your tales of the extraordinary and the everyday.

programmes.show_description: Vix from Fuzzbox shares her favourite 80s Moments, and there's a Women Of Rock Mastermix!
